statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description:
Rasheed Wallace scored 12 of his 20
points in the first quarter and Damon Stoudamire added 10 of his
19 in the opening period as the Portland Trail Blazers rode a
hot start to a 105-97 victory over the Phoenix Suns.
article.headline: Wallace, Wells get Portland past Phoenix
article.linkText: Hot start gives Blazers 11th win in last 13 games
article.story:
PORTLAND, Ore. (AP) -- Even after struggling through the first two months of the season, the Portland Trail Blazers might end up contenders.
Wallace

Wells

Rasheed Wallace and Bonzi Wells each scored 20 points as Portland extended its winning streak to five games with a 105-97 victory over the Phoenix Suns on Thursday night. Portland won for the 11th time in 13 games and dealt Phoenix its third straight road loss. "They're playing really well right now," Phoenix coach Scott Skiles said. "They're sharing the ball and they're playing very unselfishly. "There's always been a lot of talent on the Portland team, and when they play like that, they're tough to beat." Scottie Pippen just missed a triple-double, finishing with 12 points, 10 assists and nine rebounds for Portland. Dale Davis had 12 points and 14 rebounds, and Damon Stoudamire finished with 19 points and seven assists. "We're just now staring to get our chemistry together a little bit," Wells said. "Guys understand what they can do and we're playing well as a team. If you look at the stat sheet, everything is more balanced now." Six of the eight Blazers who played significant minutes scored in double figures, and six recorded at least one assist. Eight had at least one rebound. "It's definitely different than it's been in the past in terms of distribution of points," Stoudamire said. "I think everyone is just making a conscious effort to get everybody involved on the floor." Shawn Marion led the Suns with 23 points and nine rebounds. Stephon Marbury added 22 points and 12 assists, and Penny Hardaway had 17 points, six assists and six rebounds. Phoenix, which had a 4-10 record in January, fell below .500 and into a battle for the last playoff spot. "I would hope this wasn't typical of how we would play in a playoff game," Skiles said. "I thought we played pretty hard, we just fell behind so far." Portland used a 15-0 run to build a 39-24 lead by the end of the first quarter. The Trail Blazers, who shot 68.2 percent in the period, set a season high for points in a quarter with 39. "We got off to a good start and didn't lose our poise," said Davis. "We've just got to continue to build on what we've been doing." Portland outscored Phoenix 23-21 in the second quarter and led 62-45 at the break. The Trail Blazers' 62 first-half points matched their season-high, set Nov. 30 against Milwaukee. Wallace scored 17 points in the first half and the Blazers received double-figure scoring from four players in the opening half. Phoenix, which was outrebounded 49-39, switched to a zone defense in an attempt to control the tempo and keep the scoring down. "They are a good rebounding team, Marbury said. "When you're playing a zone, it's tough to rebound. We're not really guarding anybody, you're guarding an area, and that makes it tougher to rebound." Marion's 18 first-half points led Phoenix, which shot 39.1 percent in the half. The Suns were never able to get closer than seven points in the final two quarters. Shawn Kemp contributed 12 points in a reserve role for the Blazers. Portland improved to 13-1 when scoring over 100 points. The Suns dropped to 4-17 when allowing over 100. Game notes
Wallace surpassed 7,000 points for his career with a 3-pointer in the first quarter. ... Suns guard Tony Delk missed the game with the flu. It was Delk's 12th missed game of the season. ... Portland finished 11-4 in January after a 4-9 December. ... Portland's Derek Anderson left the game in the third with a sprained right big toe and did not return. ... Jake Voskuhl left the game in the second quarter with a sore left foot. He did not return.
